intro: Phyllanthus tuamotuensis, commonly known as the Tuamotu phyllanthus, is a flowering plant native to the Society Islands in French Polynesia. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and succulent-like leaves. The plant typically grows in coastal and lowland areas, often on sandy or rocky soils. Its leaves are usually simple and have a slightly waxy texture, which helps it retain moisture in its arid environment. The species is of interest to botanists due to its limited distribution and unique adaptations to its tropical habitat.
